qas.question: What is one way to group pesticides?
Give three examples of target organisms of pesticides.
What are the two types of biopesticides?
Which type of pesticides have seen rapid growth in development?

plausible_answers.text: pyrethroids, rotenoids, nicotinoids, and a fourth group that includes strychnine and scilliroside

qas.question: What are some examples of hybrid plants that have been developed?

plausible_answers.text: herbicides, insecticides, fungicides, rodenticides, and pediculicides

qas.question: What type of pesticides can't be used on organic food?
What is the one type of pesticide that can be used on organic food?
What is another word used for organic chemical structure?
How have insecticides been developing recently?

context: Pesticides can be classified by target organism (e.g., <a1_0><b5_0>herbicides, insecticides, fungicides<a1_0/>, rodenticides, and pediculicides<b5_0/> - see table), <a0_0>chemical structure<a0_0/> (e.g., organic, inorganic, synthetic, or biological (biopesticide), although the distinction can sometimes blur), and physical state (e.g. gaseous (fumigant)). Biopesticides include <a2_0>microbial pesticides and biochemical pesticides<a2_0/>. <a3_0><b6_0>Plant-derived pesticides<b6_0/>, or "<b7_0>botanicals<b7_0/><a3_0/>", have been developing <b8_0>quickly<b8_0/>. These include the <b4_0>pyrethroids, rotenoids, nicotinoids, and a fourth group that includes strychnine and scilliroside<b4_0/>.:15
